funcatron.intf

Interface MetaResponse

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Map.Entry<String,Object>>

    public interface MetaResponse
extends Iterable<Map.Entry<String,Object>>
    By default, a Func returns something that's converted into JSON using Jackson. However, if you want more control over the response, return an instance of MetaResponse

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Return the response body.

      default int getResponseCode()
      What's the HTTP response code?
      default boolean isLargeBody()
      If the response is a large one (bigger than 20K or so), it'll be inefficient to put the response on the response machinery...

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • getResponseCode

        default int getResponseCode()
        What's the HTTP response code?
        Returns:
        the HTTP response code

      • getHeaders

        default Map<String,String> getHeaders()
        Return all the headers
        Returns:
        key/value for the headers to send back

      • getContentType

        default String getContentType()

      • isLargeBody

        default boolean isLargeBody()
        If the response is a large one (bigger than 20K or so), it'll be inefficient to put the response on the response machinery... so return true and the `writeBody` method will be invoked to write the response out of band
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getBody

        default byte[] getBody()
        Return the response body. Called if `isLargeBody` is false.
        Returns:
        the bytes that make up the response

      • getBodyStream

        default InputStream getBodyStream()
        Invoked if `isLargeBody` returns true. Return the OutputStream. Note this method may be called more than one time and must always return the same outputstream
        Returns:
        the output stream

      • iterator

        default Iterator<Map.Entry<String,Object>> iterator()
        Returns an Iterator over the named fields and values in the object
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Map.Entry<String,Object>>
        Returns:
        an Iterator over the named fields and values in the object
